alert.note: Alert for Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued April 03 at 2:57PM MDT until April 04 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM MDT TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM TUESDAY TO 6 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...A Blizzard Warning is in effect from 6pm today until 6pm Tuesday. However, Winter Storm Warnings will remain in effect through 6pm Wednesday. Total Snow Accumulation will range from 1 to 2 feet for the entire storm event. The heaviest snowfall is expected to occur tonight and Tuesday with wind gusts up of 40 to 50 mph at times. The snow will begin to taper off Tuesday night and Wednesday, but the gusty winds will continue through Wednesday creating blowing snow and reduced visibility. * WHERE...In Nebraska, Dawes County and Northern Sioux County. In Wyoming, Niobrara County. * WHEN...Blizzard Warning, from 6 PM this evening to 6 PM MDT Tuesday. For Winter Storm Warnings will remain in effect until 6pm Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
